main event: Unidentified contact observed on ground-radar at Keesler AFB, Mississippi on April 7, 1962.
interesting points: The contact was called a 'TRUE' case by an organization engaged in a High-Altitude Service-Missile program, suggesting it could be the flight or positioning of some experimental missile or drone.
The report mentions a large balloon found near the facility, and requests information on its size, payload, and markings to determine if further analysis is required.

The report discusses the remains of a polyethylene-type material weighing between 1220 and 1520 lbs, with no markings or evidence of a payload, which was apparently the means for inflation of the balloon.
The balloon remains were to be stored pending further disposition instructions.
The report mentions that the balloon belonged to Mr. Claude C. Damond and he wanted it back.
